field.name: description
field.value:
My patterroute is: /<controller>/<action>/<id>.rails
When i use routing, route engine change Request.Path ex.: from: /OfferImage/GetThumb/300.rails to: /OfferImage/GetThumb.rails
And Asp.Net's OutputCache use Request.Path to make key in dictionary with cached outputs so I receive always the same output when I am requesting: /OfferImage/GetThumb/300.rails /OfferImage/GetThumb/301.rails /OfferImage/GetThumb/302.rails /OfferImage/GetThumb/303.rails becouse OutputCache thinking that is /OfferImage/GetThumb.rails

comment.author: rjlopes
roelofb
comment.text:
Fixed by fixing MR-ISSUE-539.
If you call Response.Cache.VaryByHeaders["X-Original-Url"] = true; it will work.

comment.author: kamil
comment.text:
